body.p: Accompanying this note you will be handed a petition for the pardon of W. J. Hull. I have just now been informed that the young man has been in confinement near four years. I am well acquainted with the family of the young man, I mean his relatives. They are very worthy people -- honest, industrious and economical. In behalf of his widowed Mother, and with a good conscience I respectfully ask your Excellency for his enlargement.

very respectfully
Jno. G. Monfort
Jany 27. 1865

Reference to Mr I. N. Webb.
of House of Reps. M.

House of Repress
Jany 28" 1864
Governor Bramlette

I am well acquainted with the persons whose singatures are affixed to the accompanying petition. They are all gentlemen of the first respectability in my County. The petition I observe was gotten up by the County Judge who is a highly conscientious and just man and would not, I know ask your Excellency to do an act which in good conscience you ought not to do.

Your Obt st
I N Webb
